ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Adobe (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
Printing (Complex spreads, different formats, color printing etc)
Designing (Form, color, typography)

A lot!
Graphic design techniques using Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and a photo copier
graphic design skills, working with software as well as physical tools.

I learned so much! I learned how to better use Indesign and Illustrator. I learned about graphic design history and different styles and eras of design. I learned about typography and different types of discourse in contemporary design. So much!
Much better grasp of graphic design principles and skills including photocopying, craft, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, and booklet-making.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The small group size of 14 is very helpful to get individual feedback!
The hands on approach helped me learn and improve.
Luiza and Sara were amazing teachers!
Strengths: Introduces you to a variety of adobe software (and even how to make the most of a copy machine)
very interesting and fun to work on graphic design skills. Well structured class with periodic assignments, critiques, and readings to continue to learn new skills.

Luiza is a great instructor and she designed the course so that it helps you learn so much without too much stress in just one semester. I would say that the organization of the course is a huge strength, and there are practically no weaknesses.
Very comprehensive, highly engaging, lots of exposure to different media. Well organized for the most part.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
This was, so far, my favorite class at Yale.
Unlearned so much. The group of people became close and it was always fun and engaging. Luiza and Sara were absolutely amazing teachers. 
I will genuinely miss taking this class and I recommend it to anyone with any background.

Absolutely, the class was extremely welcoming and encouraging of all ideas. This is the only class I've taken at Yale that I can say I actually enjoyed every single assignment. The pacing, the assignments, the professor, the TA--everything about the class made a supportive and engaging environment
Yes, very engaging in the design process, as well as helpful in learning adobe illustrator, indesign, photoshop.
Absolutely! Definitely take it if you are interested in design and want to learn more!

Yes. Strongly recommended for a student not in CPAR or Art who is interested in a fairly intense course running them through the fundamentals of graphic design for either instrumental or intrinsic reasons.
